result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Joshua J Gibson, in custody, appeared with Attorney Daniel J Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Katie Schalley Clerk.
2:36 p.m.
Includes 12CM648, 13CM206, 13CM207,13CM208, 13CT18, 14CF38

Agreement reached between parties

Agreement is for:
13CF282-- Count 2 Felony Bail Jumping 
13CM206- Count 1 Retail Theft
13CT13- Count 1 OWI 3rd Offense

Defendant pleads:
13CF282 Count 2: GUILTY
13CM206 Count 1: GUILTY
13CT18 Count 1: GUILTY

Defendant waives rights/jury trial
Court approves plea and finds defendant guilty

State recommends sentencing for 13CF282 Count 2:
Probation w/held sentence 3 years
1 year jail
Restitution to Colfax Police Department
Costs $268
Sentence credit of 201 days if revoked from probation

Dismiss and Read in:13CF282 Counts 1, 3-9, 14CF38, 12CM648 into plea in 13CF282

Attorney Chapman argues jail time 

State withdraws agreement for probation sentence and requests a PSI

Attorney Chapman argues against getting a PSI--defendant will be incarcerated even longer awaiting PSI

State withdraws request for PSI and will go forward with sentencing

State recommends sentencing for 13CM206
Probation w/held sentence 2 years
Restitution to Super America
Costs $243
Sentence credit of ....days if revoked from probation
Dismiss and read in 13CM206 Count 2-3, 13CM207, 13CM208

State recommends sentencing for 13CT18
Fine $1469 (includes $45)
60 days jail
24 month DL revocation
IID 
AODA/DSP

Defendant makes statement to Court

COURT ORDERS:

13CF282 Count 2
Probation w/held 3 years
$268 Costs
6 months jail--work release granted---start time forthwith
DOC 31 to be filed w/in 30 days
201 days sentence credit if revoked
Cash bond to apply to restitution


13CM206 Count 1
Probation w/held 2 years concurrent to 13CF282
$243 Costs
DOC 31 to filed w/in 30 days
Cash bond posted to apply to court costs
14 days credit if revoked from probation


13CT18 Count 1
$1469 Fine includes $45 fee
60 days jail--Huber granted after first 48 hours. Start time is forthwith.
24 month DL Revocation--credit for admin. suspension
AODA
IID

Dismiss and Read In:
12CM648, 13CF282 Count 1, 3-9, 13CM206 Counts 2-3, 13CM207, 13CM208, 13CT18 Count 2, 14CF38

Attorney Chapman requests that the cash bond on 14CF193 be amended to a signature bond--Denied by Judge Smeltzer
Plea hearing on July 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant, Joshua J Gibson with Attorney Daniel J Chapman appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron Olson.  Kim Dean - Clerk

State - no agreement
Chapman - requests one day jury trial on 13CT18
13CT18 is Branch 1 file

Brian Peters analyst for alcohol -
